column4: hello, maybe its a silly question, but how can i "downgrade" my kernel version.. i need to install the same kernel "kind" i have, but a different version. (i have 2.6.26 and i need 2.6.22 or 2.6.20)
i want to do that the "ubuntu" way
sudo apt-get install linux-image-2.6.22 (press tab here a few times)
mm it doesn't do anything... maybe i doesn't have in my "packages list"
you can type a partial package name and tab complete just like in here
you can then install any of those packages useing sudo apt-get install
there's only two packages ( linux-patch-xenomai  and iotop )
i need to add some package source to my apt sources.list ? becouse i dont have other kernels..
could you tell me how can i add more "packages" to my packages list?
becouse i dont have that packages when i use apt
the kernels are in the standard repos, if the repos ave removed the old ones you will need to find other repos which still have them
yes you are right i must add an old "repo version" to my sources.list, then update the package list, install the old kernel image, and then remove the old repo from my list and do an update again
